metadata.Title: CVE-2020-13397 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in FreeRDP before 2.1.1. An out-of-bounds (OOB) read vulnerability has been detected in security_fips_decrypt in libfreerdp/core/security.c due to an uninitialized value.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-13397` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

freerdp2-shadow-x11 - 2.1.1+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
freerdp2-wayland - 2.1.1+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
freerdp2-x11 - 2.1.1+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libfreerdp-client2-2 - 2.1.1+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libfreerdp-server2-2 - 2.1.1+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libfreerdp-shadow-subsystem2-2 - 2.1.1+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libfreerdp-shadow2-2 - 2.1.1+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libfreerdp2-2 - 2.1.1+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libuwac0-0 - 2.1.1+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libwinpr-tools2-2 - 2.1.1+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libwinpr2-2 - 2.1.1+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
winpr-utils - 2.1.1+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freerdp2 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.1+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
